title: What will a stacked leaderboard bring? Looking ahead to Saturday at the Masters
content: With Rose, McIlroy, Scheffler and DeChambeau all in contention, it is shaping up to be an exciting weekend.

title: Jokic third ever to average triple-double in season
content: Nikola Jokic will average a triple-double for the season, joining Russell Westbrook and Oscar Robertson as the only players in NBA history to achieve that feat.

title: Reports: Carr's '25 status at risk due to shoulder
content: New Orleans Saints quarterback Derek Carr has a shoulder injury that could put his status for the 2025 season in jeopardy, according to multiple reports Friday.

title: C's proud of 60th win, 'shifting gears' for playoffs
content: Jayson Tatum took time to acknowledge "another incredible season" for the 60-win Celtics, but said the team is "shifting gears" as it prepares to defend its title in the postseason.

title: Rose remains atop bunched Masters leaderboard
content: Justin Rose is still in the lead at the Masters. He suddenly has a lot of all-star company around him.

title: Langer signs off as run at weekend falls 1 short
content: In his final Masters, Bernhard Langer missed playing the weekend by one shot, with his par putt on the 18th hole Friday narrowly off the mark.

title: Source: QB Lock set for second stint in Seattle
content: Drew Lock is expected to sign with the Seahawks, a source confirmed to ESPN. Lock is now set to back up Sam Darnold after spending two seasons as Geno Smith's backup in Seattle.

title: Sources: S. Carolina's Fulwiley plans portal entry
content: South Carolina's MiLaysia Fulwiley intends to enter the transfer portal, sources told ESPN. Fulwiley shined off the bench in helping the Gamecocks to the past two Final Fours.

title: Rising up the board: WNBA draft tix prices soar
content: The price of tickets to attend Monday night's WNBA draft has nearly doubled from last year. The Dallas Wings hold the No. 1 pick with UConn's Paige Bueckers expected to be the first selection.

title: 'Everybody in the organization was miserable': Inside the Nuggets' shocking dual firings
content: With less than a week left in the regular season, Denver fired its head coach and GM, ending a yearslong cold war, and risking the NBA's most precious commodity: the prime of three-time NBA MVP Nikola Jokic.

title: NBA postseason tracker: Eastern Conference playoffs set
content: Tracking which teams have clinched for the playoffs with the 2024-25 NBA regular season nearing its conclusion.

title: Power Rankings: Predictions for every team's 2025-26 contention status
content: From top Cup contenders to teams on the bubble to those still building, here's the "next year now" for all 32.

title: Projecting WNBA draft 1st round: Bueckers still No. 1 as Malonga rises; Van Lith, Prince out
content: The No. 2 pick sees an international entry, while Hailey Van Lith and Sedona Prince drop out of the first round.

title: With Flacco signing, Browns in position to forgo drafting QB at No. 2
content: With Flacco back in the fold, the Browns have a veteran quarterback on the roster whom they can trust to run the offense in 2025.

title: Bayern, Dortmund cannot afford to lose
content: Saturday's Klassiker isn't first vs. second, but Bayern and Dortmund's seasons hinge on their rivalry match.

title: Arteta hails Rice ignoring set-piece coach vs. Real
content: Arsenal boss Mikel Arteta has praised Declan Rice after the midfielder revealed that he ignored the advice of the club's set-piece coach before scoring the first of two sensational free kicks against Real Madrid on Tuesday.

title: Salah signs two-year Liverpool contract extension
content: Liverpool forward Mohamed Salah has signed a contract extension, ending monthslong uncertainty over his future at Anfield, the club announced.

title: Pulisic assist helps Milan to emphatic Serie A win
content: AC Milan secured a convincing 4-0 victory at Udinese in Serie A on Friday, with Sérgio Conceição's side earning its first win in nearly a month.

title: USMNT to open Gold Cup vs. T&T in San Jose
content: The United States will open the CONCACAF Gold Cup against Trinidad and Tobago on June 15 at San Jose, California, play Saudi Arabia four days later at Austin, Texas, and close first-round play in Group D against Haiti on June 22 at Arlington, Texas.

title: Milan boss praises Udinese fans' Maignan gesture
content: AC Milan coach Sérgio Conceição praised the way Udinese fans applauded Mike Maignan when he had to be carried off on a stretcher following a collision with AC Milan teammate Álex Jiménez.

title: USWNT's Midge Purce fit to return after year out
content: Gotham FC and USWNT winger Midge Purce is in line to return from a year-long injury absence in Sunday's NWSL clash with the North Carolina Courage.

title: Amorim hesitant to rotate in EPL: 'You can't at Utd'
content: Ruben Amorim has said he won't throw away games in the Premier League to aid Manchester United's bid to win the Europa League ahead of their tough trip to Newcastle United on Sunday.

title: Maresca: Jackson our No. 9 but Delap 'fantastic'
content: Chelsea boss Enzo Maresca has said that Liam Delap can become a "top player" but insists that the club's ideal transfer target is a "copy" of their current No. 9 Nicolas Jackson.

title: Star exits, coaching changes, lawsuits: After awful 2024, San Diego is rebounding
content: After a turbulent 2024 season on and off the field -- including the exit of Naomi Girma, the retirement of Alex Morgan and several coaching changes -- the new-look San Diego Wave are hoping for better times ahead.

title: 'An ordinary guy': What's John Daly doing at the Hooters in Augusta?
content: Golf's everyman hero hasn't played the Masters since 2006, but every year he shows up in town to hang and sell merch.

title: The Kid behind the camera: Best of Ken Griffey Jr.'s 2025 Masters photography
content: Baseball Hall of Famer Ken Griffey Jr. is roaming the greens of Augusta as a credentialed photographer.

title: From The Babe's home run handles to Bonds' maple mashers: A brief history of bats
content: The torpedo is the talk of 2025, but bat experiments have changed baseball and created controversy for 150 years.

title: Experts pick 10-man rosters from 2025 class: Who has the best superteam?
content: Mel Kiper Jr., Matt Miller, Jordan Reid and Field Yates drafted their own rosters of 2025 draft prospects. Check out all 40 picks -- and vote on the winner.

title: Ohio State's Will Howard believes he's the best QB in this NFL draft class
content: Howard says confidence in himself helped him face adversity, reach NFL draft class with 'unbelievable talent.'

title: Five years since Bahrain 2020: The tech that saved Grosjean's life
content: It's been five years since Romain Grosjean's fiery Bahrain crash. F1's ongoing search for safety saved him.

title: Monaco-inspired Long Beach is now a jewel in IndyCar's crown
content: IndyCar is living the dream of Monaco in Southern California as Long Beach celebrates 50 years of "the race."

title: After Salah's contract, where do Liverpool now need to improve?
content: Liverpool still have breathing room but have lost three times in four games in all competitions. What's going on? And how can they improve the squad in the summer?

title: Transfer rumors, news: Arsenal, Tottenham keen on Bayern Munich's Kingsley Coman
content: Arsenal and Tottenham are options to sign Bayern Munich's Kingsley Coman. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: 'Stampede-like situation': Dust storm triggers chaos at Delhi airport, flights delayed
content: A severe dust storm paralyzed flight operations at Delhi's IGI Airport, causing significant delays, diversions, and cancellations. Hundreds of passengers were stranded, leading to widespread complaints of airline mismanagement and mistreatment. Passengers voiced their frustration on social media, citing lack of information, constant rescheduling, and inadequate assistance from airline staff amidst the chaos.

title: Pak violates ceasefire along LoC, Army JCO killed during encounter with terrorists
content: An Indian Army JCO was killed in a gunfight with terrorists attempting to infiltrate across the Line of Control in Jammu's Akhnoor sector, marking a ceasefire violation by Pakistan. This incident occurred shortly after brigade commander-level talks aimed at de-escalating border tensions. Separately, in Kishtwar, security forces eliminated three Pakistani terrorists during a joint operation, recovering a cache of weapons.

title: Video captures IDF taking out Hamas tunnel hidden beneath kindergarten, school in Rafah
content: Israeli troops in southern Gaza discovered and destroyed a Hamas terror tunnel located beneath a former kindergarten compound in Rafah, as reported by the IDF. The tunnel's entrance was situated just 100 meters from a school, highlighting Hamas's alleged practice of concealing terror infrastructure within civilian areas. The IDF asserts that Hamas exploits civilian institutions and uses the population as human shields, violating international law.

title: 'Replaced with Marathi': Hindi out at metro site in Thane district
content: Following MNS protests against Hindi signage at a Mumbai Metro construction site, MMRDA began replacing it with Marathi. MNS now plans to target educational institutions, demanding prominent Marathi name boards. This comes after bank unions alleged intimidation by individuals claiming to be MNS members during a previous language campaign, even as Raj Thackeray paused the bank-focused efforts.

title: White House explains why Trump's tariffs were 'necessary'
content: The White House defends Trump's tariffs as a necessary correction to decades of failed trade policies that harmed American workers and industry. Citing job losses and rising trade deficits, the administration highlights recent investments from major companies as evidence of the strategy's success. However, the tariff implementation has caused market disruption and criticism, raising questions about the long-term impact.

title: US: We will revoke or deny Visa if your social media posts are in support of ...
content: USCIS has officially declared that social media posts can now impact visa decisions. The agency will scrutinize accounts, potentially denying visas or residency to individuals posting content deemed anti-Semitic or supportive of designated terrorist groups like Hamas and Hezbollah. This policy, effective immediately, extends to student visas and Green Card applications, raising concerns about freedom of expression.

title: 'Assam remained peaceful despite 40% Muslim population': Himanta on Waqf protests
content: Assam CM Himanta Biswa Sarma reported that the state remained largely peaceful despite limited protests against the Waqf Amendment Act, attributing the calm to effective groundwork by the Assam Police. He highlighted the state's communal harmony as preparations intensify for the Bohag Bihu festivities. The Waqf Amendment Act, 2025, aims to enhance the management of waqf properties.

title: Watch: Vehicles torched as Waqf protest turns violent in Murshidabad
content: Fresh protests against the Waqf (Amendment) Act in West Bengal's Murshidabad district turned violent, with demonstrators torching vehicles in Jangipur. Security forces have been deployed to restore order, and the situation is reportedly under control. Prohibitory orders and internet suspensions are in place to curb further unrest, while the state government faces criticism over its handling of the situation.

title: Walmart boycott: World's largest retailer tells protesters, 'we are America's ...'
content: Walmart is facing a week-long boycott, "Walmart Blackout," organized by People’s Union USA over DEI rollbacks and tax policies. Walmart defends its community contributions and economic impact, citing significant tax payments and charitable donations. Data suggests Walmart is more resilient to boycotts compared to Target, which experienced a larger impact from similar protests.

title: Indian-origin US politician Anand Shah charged in illegal gambling case
content: In New Jersey, a major crackdown on illegal gambling has led to charges against 39 individuals, including Indian-origin Prospect Park Councilman Anand Shah. Attorney General Matt Platkin announced that the operation, linked to the Lucchese crime family, generated over $3 million. Shah allegedly managed illicit poker games and an online sportsbook.

title: IPL: Pressure mounts on Pant as LSG clash with Titans
content: Despite Rishabh Pant's struggle to find batting form, Lucknow Super Giant have secured three wins out of five matches. Nicholas Pooran and Mitchell Marsh will once again be the key players for LSG when they take on Gujarat Titans on Saturday.

title: Kia Syros bags five-star safety rating from Bharat NCAP: Detailed results
content: The Kia Syros SUV has achieved a five-star safety rating from Bharat NCAP, scoring high in both adult and child occupant protection. Tested variants included the HTK (O) manual and HTX Plus automatic, both with a 1.0-litre turbo-petrol engine.

title: Twitter is ..., Elon Musk responds to China and US meme-war on X
content: Elon Musk acknowledged the escalating China-US meme war on X, formerly Twitter, amidst rising trade tensions. AI-generated memes are targeting figures like Trump and Musk, sparking debate about tariffs and manufacturing. These memes reflect the complexities of US-China relations, with political cartoons depicting coercive diplomacy and escalating tariffs imposed by both nations.

title: IPL match today: LSG vs GT - all you need to know
content: Today's IPL match features a compelling face-off between Nicholas Pooran, the tournament's leading run-scorer, and Mohammed Siraj, a formidable fast bowler. Gujarat Titans, leading the table, clash with Lucknow Super Giants, who are showing signs of improvement. While GT has dominated previous encounters, LSG secured the most recent victory.

title: To push self-deportation, Trump admin lists thousands living immigrants as dead
content: The Trump administration reportedly marked over 6,000 living immigrants as deceased. This action cancelled their Social Security numbers. It also restricted their ability to work or receive benefits. This move is part of a broader plan to limit the stay of immigrants. Officials aim to push immigrants to self-deport. The policy also grants immigration authorities access to IRS taxpayer data.

title: J&K: 3 terrorists killed in ongoing Kishtwar encounter; war-like stores recovered
content: In a successful counter-terror operation in Jammu and Kashmir's Kishtwar district, the Indian Army has eliminated two Pakistani terrorists. The operation, conducted in the Chhatru area amidst challenging weather conditions, led to the recovery of a significant cache of weapons, including AK and M4 rifles.

title: Happy Hanuman Jayanti: Top 50 wishes, messages, quotes and more
content: Hanuman Jayanti, celebrating Lord Hanuman's birth on April 12, 2025, is a day for prayers, fasting, and reading the Hanuman Chalisa. Devotees seek blessings for strength and protection through bhajans and kirtans. Share heartfelt wishes, messages, and quotes with loved ones to enhance this auspicious occasion, fostering positivity and devotion among family, friends, and colleagues.

title: Watch: Woman drops kids from balcony as fire rages in Ahmedabad highrise
content: A fire erupted at Parishkar Apartments in Ahmedabad, triggering a chaotic evacuation. Residents made daring escapes from balconies as flames engulfed the building's cable chute. Firefighters rescued eighteen people, some with minor injuries. The blaze, fueled by garbage and the building's power supply, caused extensive damage. Investigations are underway to determine the exact cause, and affected families are receiving assistance.

title: IPL 2025: New low for MS Dhoni & Co
content: Kolkata Knight Riders' spinners capitalized on a conducive Chennai pitch, dismantling CSK for their lowest total at Chepauk. Sunil Narine's explosive batting then sealed an emphatic eight-wicket victory, significantly boosting KKR's net run-rate.

title: 'I got every answer right!' Trump claims perfect score in physical exam
content: President Trump underwent his annual physical at Walter Reed, confidently stating he aced the cognitive test. While specifics remain private, a report promising transparency is expected soon. The 2018 evaluation revealed excellent cardiovascular health despite being overweight, with managed cholesterol. A past COVID-19 hospitalization adds context as the nation awaits the latest health update.

title: Russia labels ex-foreign minister Andrei Kozyrev a 'foreign agent'
content: Andrei Kozyrev, the first foreign minister of post-Soviet Russia and a vocal critic of Vladimir Putin, has been designated a "foreign agent" by Russia's justice ministry. The ministry accuses Kozyrev, who resides in the United States, of spreading false information about the government and military activities, particularly regarding the war in Ukraine.

title: 80 dead in 72 hours in Bihar thunderstorms and lightning strikes
content: Devastating thunderstorms and lightning strikes in Bihar have claimed 80 lives in the past two days, with Nalanda reporting the highest number of deaths. The disaster management department attributes the increase in fatalities to climate change and a lack of awareness among villagers, despite issuing weather warnings.

title: Hanuman Jayanti 2025: Date, puja timings, and rituals
content: Hanuman Jayanti, celebrating Lord Hanuman's birth, falls on April 13, 2025, honoring his devotion, strength, and wisdom. Devotees observe fasts, chant prayers, and offer unique offerings like sindoor, seeking blessings for courage and protection. The day is auspicious for overcoming obstacles and pacifying negative influences, with temples hosting elaborate celebrations and continuous recitations.

title: 'Adam Silver if you wanna fine somebody, fine that': LeBron called out by Isiah
content: NBA legend Isiah Thomas criticized LeBron James for practicing shirtless before a crucial game against the Houston Rockets, deeming it unprofessional and urging the NBA to fine him. Thomas argued that such behavior diminishes the league's professionalism. However, fans online largely disagreed with Thomas, with some calling him a hypocrite and defending James's pre-game routine.

title: US Judge rules Columbia University activist Mahmoud Khalil can be deported
content: An immigration judge in Louisiana has ruled that Columbia University student Mahmoud Khalil, a green card holder, can be deported as a national security risk. ​The Lousiana federal court's ruling is crucial but Khalil won't be deported immediately as his lawyers will get the chance to fight the proceedings before a final determination is made.

title: Trump says Tehran may soften stance on nukes amid military and economic strain
content: Amidst internal unrest and international pressure, US President Trump suggests Iran might be more receptive to discussions, emphasising diplomacy while warning of severe consequences if talks fail. Negotiations are planned in Muscat, involving US envoy Steve Witkoff and Iranian Deputy Foreign Minister Abbas Araghchi. Iran faces challenges with its proxies and economic sanctions, yet continues uranium enrichment, raising nuclear concerns.

title: Kelce’s focus on 2025 season: Why Taylor is stepping back amid NFL comeback drive
content: Travis Kelce is reportedly prioritizing his football career in 2025, potentially his last season, by minimizing distractions, including his relationship with Taylor Swift. Following Super Bowl criticism, the couple has retreated from the spotlight, with Swift possibly taking a step back from attending games. Kelce aims to focus solely on football, seeking a standout season without off-field drama.

title: Army JCO killed in encounter along LoC in Jammu, infiltration bid thwarted
content: Army troops picked up the movement of a group of heavily armed terrorists near a stream in a forward forest setting in the Keri Bhattal area late on April 11, 2025, and challenged them, leading to a fierce gun fight

title: Protests against Waqf Act in parts of Hyderabad
content: Demonstrations were seen near the Mecca Masjid near Charminar, Azizia Masjid in Humayun Nagar, Ujale Shah Masjid in Saidabad, and other neighbourhoods.

title: At least 6 militants arrested in Manipur’s Bishnupur
content: The arrests come as the Centre is making efforts to bring back peace, which has been elusive since ethnic violence broke out in the state in May 2023

title: India has potential to be key player in automotive global supply chain: NITI Aayog report
content: With a near-neutral trade balance and a cumulative cost disability of nearly 10% compared to competitors like China, India’s auto component sector faces structural hurdles that impede its competitiveness, says per the report.

title: Day temperatures in Telangana likely to rise and reach a peak in May
content: From about April 15-18 the day temperatures likely to rise and reach the peak in May. This is also the period when the hot Northerly winds will pick up momentum over the prevailing Easterlies, says TGPS senior weather consultant Y. V. Rama Rao

title: Andhra Pradesh Child Rights Commission expresses concern after finding minor mothers at Old GGH
content: Four of the ten mothers we spoke to said that they got married when they were 15 and this tells it all about the child marriage scenario in the State, says APSCPCR Chairman

title: Sarpanch’s murder widens caste fault lines in Maharashtra’s Beed
content: In December 2024, a sarpanch in Massajog village in the Marathwada region of Maharashtra was murdered. The incident led to the resignation of Dhananjay Munde, a Minister of the Nationalist Congress Party, after his aide turned out to be a key accused person in the case. Vinaya Deshpande Pandit reports on how the incident has highlighted the problem of extortion gangs in Beed and widened the rift between Marathas and Vanjaris

title: Spinal muscular atrophy patients welcome development of generic drug; call for government intervention to ensure access
content: Though pharma company Natco’s generic version of a drug to treat the condition could cut costs from Roche’s rate of $7,150 to less than $185, activists have called for Centre to invoke the Patents Act and ensure affordable access for all SMA patients

title: U.S. Vice-President Vance, NSA Waltz expected to visit India from April 21
content: Vance's visit is likely to be more of a private trip, even though it will have official components. Waltz's visit will be a purely business trip.

title: Evidence of systemic corruption found in MAWS Dept., says ED
content: Evidence suggests involvement of family members of Minister K.N. Nehru, including MP Arun Nehru and Ravichandran, in diverting funds, claims ED

title: Former MP Gorantla Madhav, 5 others held for assaulting accused in police custody
content: The YSRCP leader and his associates allegedly intercepted a police vehicle and attacked Chebrolu Kiran, a YouTuber who allegedly made objectionable comments against Y.S. Bharathi, while he was being taken by the police from Mangalagiri to Guntur

title: Andhra Health Minister promises infra upgrade at govt. hospitals
content: Satya Kumar Yadav inaugurates cath labs established at ₹6.06 crore at Government General Hospital in Ongole

title: Over 250-years-old Mughal document throws light on tax waiver for pilgrims at Allahabad
content: The firman in shikasta script directs the public officers or clerks, and other senior officials monitoring movements along the river not to charge pilgrims who come for the holy dip or bath, Director of TSARI Zareena Parveen said

title: Drive for improving soil health in Rajasthan set to empower rural women
content: The ‘soil and compost Swaraj campaign’ involves upgrading of the traditional cow dung and farmyard manure through scientific methods and an increase in the soil fertility by enriching it with rock phosphate and biofertilisers

title: Kolkata Police justifies use of force against protesting teachers as ‘self-defence’
content: Kolkata Police Commissioner Manoj Verma raised questions on who would take responsibility for the 13 police personnel ‘severely injured’ by protesting teachers

title: BJP vs Congress | How do they fuel their election campaigns?
content: Between 2013-14 and 2023-24, electoral bonds and trusts have been major contributors to both as BJP built its war chest, while Congress’ funds dwindled

title: National meet on communal harmony in Vijayawada on April 13
content: Rajya Sabha member and Chairman of the Minority wing of the All-India Congress Committee (AICC) Imran Pratapgarhi and Supreme Court lawyer and recipient of Ramon Magsaysay Award Prashant Bhushan to participate

title: Congress leader Sachin Pilot says Grand Alliance will decide CM face after the election results in Bihar
content: Mr. Pilot says the CM face of Rashtriya Janata Dal (RJD)-Congress led alliance will be decided after winning the Assembly election slated later in the year; RJD leader Tejashwi Yadav had earlier unilaterally announced that he was the CM face

title: Amit Shah’s Maharashtra visit puts spotlight on Mahayuti power struggle over Raigad, Nashik
content: With the issue of appointment of guardian ministers for the two districts remaining unresolved, a leader told The Hindu that Amit Shah will broker a compromise between the alliance partners — the BJP, Shiv Sena and NCP

title: Forest Dept. plans to establish an international bird centre in the Agaram Reserve Forest
content: According to DFO K. Karthikeyani, the proposed facility near Kazhuveli bird sanctuary will include an awareness and interpretation centre, and research-cum-educational facilities with amenities for tourists; the DPR is under discussion

title: IMA condemns attacks on hospitals following pregnant woman’s death in Pune
content: The IMA has strongly condemned certain “irresponsible” public statements made by political leaders in the aftermath of the incident

title: Protests over Waqf Act continue in West Bengal
content: Amid violent protest over the Waqf (Amendment) Act, West Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee has assured the members of the minority community that she will protect their rights and land and asked them not to be “restless”

title: Special court takes cognizance of offence against CM’s daughter, others in CMRL pay-off case
content: Additional District and Sessions Judge 7, Ernakulam, ordered summons to be issued against Veena Thaikandiyil and others.  The accused will have to personally appear before court on a scheduled date and apply for bail. While Veena has been arraigned as 11th accused, her now-defunct IT firm, Exalogic Solutions Private Limited, Karnataka, is the 12th accused

title: SAARC Development Fund should do more work, experts say amid USAID cuts
content: Diplomatic sources and experts are suggesting that the SAARC Development Fund should broaden its focus and bring in infrastructure and connectivity projects under its ambit

title: ‘Vruthi’ seeks to allay public concern on waste management plants
content: Participants of national conclave taken to the sewage treatment plant at Muttathara, managed by the Thiruvananthapuram Corporation, which is functioning without problems raised by the local population

title: Turmeric-added milk may soon be served to passengers in flights and trains
content: National Turmeric Board is preparing to launch ‘Golden Milk’ project, says its Chairman Ganga Reddy; he advises farmers in Andhra Pradesh to cultivate high-curcumin turmeric varieties to enhance profits

title: MBA fiasco: Lok Ayukta comes flays Kerala University for mishandling answer sheets
content: Directs university to award average marks to a student, based on her academic record and results in other examinations

title: Will publish list of ‘tainted’ and ‘untainted’ candidates, Bengal govt. tells teachers
content: Mr. Basu said the West Bengal School Service Commission is ready to publish a list of tainted and untainted candidates; teachers say they will continue protests till the list is published

title: Former West Bengal Minister Abdur Rezzak Mollah passes away
content: Once with the CPI(M), Mollah, an agricultural leader, had openly criticised Left Front govt. for the land acquisition at Singur and Nandigram

title: Health dept. issues alert on chikungunya
content: Alert prompted by an epidemic ‘medium-intensity’ in Reunion Islands in the eastern coast of Africa. The first chikungunya outbreak in Kerala in 2006-07 had been an extension of the outbreak in these islands

title: Alappuzha Collector submits Vembanad rejuvenation plan to Chief Minister
content: Document includes summary of activities organised in the district under the aegis of district administration and local self-government bodies, along with recommendations submitted by expert committees for rejuvenation of lake

title: Junior doctors at Siddhartha govt. college complain of ragging; inquiry ordered
content: They alleged that some seniors and interns were ill-treating and using abusive language against them in the hostel

title: Unified health coverage scheme rolled out in Odisha
content: The scheme which combines Ayushman Bharat and ‘Gopabandhu Jan Arogya Yojana’ will cover 1.03 crore families (3.46 crore population) of Odisha

title: ‘Sita Rama Kalyanam’ turns out to be a visual delight for the devout at Vontimitta in Andhra Pradesh
content: Chief Minister Chandrababu Naidu, accompanied by his wife Bhuvaneswari, offers ‘silk vastrams’ to the deities ahead of the celestial wedding; TTD, which manages the temple, makes arrangements on an unprecedented scale

title: Six-year-old boy drowned in pond after resisting sexual assault attempt; accused held
content: The accused joined local residents who were searching for the missing child, pretending to be part of the search effort

title: Finally, Cabinet accepts caste census report; discussion at next meeting
content: A discussion is slated for the next Cabinet meeting, as some Ministers wanted to study the report and the recommendations

title: CPI(M) will create a cultural wall of resistance against RSS bid to stifle artistic freedom and political dissent: Govindan
content: CPI(M) State secretary says RSS is attempting to undermine the secular and liberal foundations of the Constitution

title: Developed world more reliable trading partner than China, says Piyush Goyal
content: Commerce Minister Piyush Goyal indicated that India would be better positioned to work with developed countries with “mutual trust and mutual benefit”

title: School exam success rate: Concern over dip in Assam, jump in Meghalaya
content: Meghalaya’s high pass rate is criticised for potentially compromising education quality, while Assam’s drop in pass rate is seen as a failure of the government

title: CPI(M) criticises ex-CM Biplab Deb over his temple theft statement
content: Mr. Deb had claimed that the “CPI(M) had in the past sold out the gold jewellery of the Tripura Sundari Temple and replaced them with fakes”; the former CM provided no evidence for this allegation

title: Yellow Line of Namma Metro likely to begin limited operations by June
content: The 19.15 km Yellow Line, stretching from R.V. Road to Bommasandra, has been structurally complete for several months. However, its launch has been delayed primarily due to the late arrival of driverless metro trains.

title: Chaos After Delhi Dust Storm: 205 Flights Delayed, Departures An Hour Late
content: A strong dust storm whipped up Delhi and adjoining areas on Friday evening, a day after a dust storm and moderate rain lashed parts of the national capital.

title: Tahawwur Rana's Probe Reveals Elusive "Dubai Man" Who Knew Of 26/11 Attacks
content: More than 15 years after the 26/11 Mumbai terror attack, anti-terror agency NIA is now zeroing in on an elusive figure who allegedly met Tahawwur Rana, one of the key accused, in Dubai before the carnage.

title: Army Stops Infiltration Bid Along Line Of Control, Soldier Killed In Action
content: An army personnel has been killed in action in a gunfight after security forces intercepted terrorists making an infiltration attempt near the Line of Control (LoC) in Jammu and Kashmir's Rajouri district, officials said today.

title: "Still...": Amit Shah On BJP's K Annamalai 'Being Removed' For AIADMK Alliance
content: Refusing to be drawn into the speculation surrounding K Annamalai's removal as the Tamil Nadu president of the BJP, Union Home Minister and senior party leader Amit Shah has said Mr Annamalai still holds the post.

title: Court Allows Columbia Graduate Pro-Palestinian Mahmoud Khalil's Deportation
content: A U.S. immigration judge ruled on Friday that Palestinian activist Mahmoud Khalil can be deported, allowing President Donald Trump's administration to proceed with its effort to remove the Columbia University student from the United States.

title: "Won't Negotiate At Gunpoint": Piyush Goyal, S Jaishankar Double Down On US
content: India will never negotiate at gunpoint, nor will it hurry into a deal over issues that are in the interest of its people, Commerce Minister Piyush Goyal said after Donald Trump's move to "pause" the reciprocal tariffs Washington imposed on New Delhi.

title: Trump Defends Policy After China Hits US With 125% Tariffs
content: President Donald Trump insisted Friday that his tariff policy was "doing really well" despite China hiking levies on US goods to 125 percent in the spiraling trade war between the world's two biggest economies.

title: Live Updates: Andhra Pradesh Class 11, 12 Results To Be Released Today
content: Andhra Pradesh Class 11, 12 Results 2025 LIVE Updates: To access their Manabadi Results 2025, students must enter their hall ticket number and date of birth on the result portal.

title: Zerodha CEO Tells Bill Gates "You're Always In Hurry". His Response
content: Bill Gates has been to India on several occasions and met Prime Minister Narendra Modi, Union Ministers JP Nadda, Hardeep Singh Puri and Jitendra Singh, among others.

title: "Brain Stopped Working?" Dhoni Faces Savage Question After CSK's Loss
content: MS Dhoni-led Chennai Super Kings slumped to their biggest defeat in the IPL (in terms of balls remaining) on Friday against Kolkata Knight Riders

title: Woman Friend In Washroom, 38-Year-Old Techie Dies By Suicide At Noida Hotel
content: A software engineer was found dead in a hotel room in Uttar Pradesh's Noida last night. Umesh Kumar allegedly died by suicide while his woman friend with whom he was staying at the hotel was in the washroom.

title: Indian-Origin Politician In US Charged For Mafia-Run Gambling Operation
content: An Indian-origin municipal councillor has been charged with participating in a mafia-run gambling operation, according to New Jersey Attorney General Matthew Platkin.

title: What Caused Roman Empire's Collapse? Scientists May Finally Have The Answer
content: Ice age triggered by volcanic ash from three massive eruptions that lowered global temperatures may have caused the Roman Empire's collapse.

title: In Tahawwur Rana Probe, An ISI Link, And Two Names: Major Iqbal, Sameer Ali
content: As Tahawwur Hussain Rana, key conspirator in the 2008 Mumbai terror attacks, sits in a high-security cell in New Delhi, fresh interrogations and years-old indictments are peeling back layers of one of the most high-profile cases in Indian history.

title: Who Is Lawyer C Sankaran Nair And Why His Story Needs To Be Told
content: In an age of manufactured heroes, here is a real one. And his story, now more than ever, demands to be heard.

title: Dalit youth stripped over inter-caste relationship in Chhattisgarh; six held
content: The 21-year-old victim was caught while visiting a 16-year-old girl, beaten and tortured by her family, subjected to casteist slurs, and filmed; police take suo motu cognisance of videos, arrest six accused

title: Stand-off between Kerala High Court lawyers and judges turns bitter
content: In a letter, Kerala High Court Advocates’ Association asks judges “not to meddle with the affairs of the association.” This follows an April 9 order against the association for resorting to boycott of the court.

title: HYDRAA signs MoU with NRSC towards making land/lake data accessible to people
content: The MoU inked by HYDRAA Commissioner A.V. Ranganath and National Remote Sensing Centre Director Prakash Chauhan also aims to facilitate a comprehensive exercise of collecting and compiling data on stormwater drains and parks

title: Palayam market redevelopment caught in a stalemate
content: A good number of traders have refused to move to the rehabilitation block nearby citing, among other issues, unhygienic conditions and lack of proper ventilation at the facility

title: Naidu government boosts girls education in Parvatipuram with new hostel
content: New hostel coming up under PM-USHA scheme aims to reduce dropout rate among girls in tribal areas, says TDP MLA Bonela Vijayachandra

title: A golf course on a sweater? Matthieu Pavon leads best of Masters fashion
content: a fine day 1 at the master after chipping into the drink at the Hole 15 . he's not the only one with some unique fashion in Georgia this week . there's plenty of different styles to choose from this week's tournament .

title: Long streaks, fast finishes: UFC 314 by the numbers
content: former champion Alexander Volkanovski faces first-time challenger Diego Lopes in the main event of Saturday's UFC 314 . there are 13 fights in all this weekend, and here's a number to remember for each . jiu-jitsu specialist Chase Hooper is also on the card .

title: Rare Lizards Seized In Assam, 3 Men Were Trying To Sell Them For 60 Lakh Each
